author: qu0b
content: moved the panda pulse for bal devnets to #interop

author: matkt0
content: Hi <@796570016966770688> any news regarding this failing tests ?

author: m0_ox
content: Ah sorry to miss this comment. Do you have any examples? These tests were filled with BPO2 blob params. You have to make sure that you are running with this turned on. This is something I'd love to get clients agreeing on too. I think at some point we agreed that named forks would not be on the blob schedule but I still see some instances where a client is looking for an `amsterdam: {...}` blob schedule.

author: m0_ox
content: Without more context, the one thing that comes to mind is that these failures are related to BPO2 params. I will do a quick check locally to see if I can reproduce some.

author: m0_ox
content: Can I ask how you're running them locally? When I run a few of the 4844 tests from the current `forks/amsterdam` branch of `execution-specs` against Besu running in hive with `bal-devnet-2` branch I don't see failures. But perhaps I ran only a small subset. If you can give me any test names that would help.
